cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with information theory and entropy measures, which are typically studied in the sub-category of cs.IT (Information Theory). The paper also mentions the minimum average probability of error, which is a common topic in the sub-category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The analysis of probability distributions and their norms is a common topic in the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning), and the study of mutual information is a common topic in the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Finally, the paper's focus on deriving sharp bounds is related to the sub-category of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), which often deals with optimization and approximation problems.
